title: Samkhya
summary: Samkhya (Sanskrit: साङ्ख्य, IAST: sāṅkhya) is a dualistic āstika school of Indian philosophy,[1][2][3] regarding reality c.q. human experience as being constituted by two independent ultimate principles, puruṣa ('consciousness' or spirit); and prakṛti, (cognition, mind and emotions, c.q. nature or matter).[4]
